candidates.title: Update bitflags requirement from 1.2 to 2.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Updates the requirements on [bitflags](https://github.com/bitflags/bitflags) to permit the latest version.
Release notes

Sourced from bitflags's releases.

2.0.0

What's Changed

  • Fix a typo and call out MSRV bump by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#259
  • BitFlags trait by @​arturoc in bitflags/bitflags#220
  • Add a hidden trait to discourage manual impls of BitFlags by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#261
  • Sanitize Ok by @​konsumlamm in bitflags/bitflags#266
  • Fix bug in Debug implementation by @​konsumlamm in bitflags/bitflags#268
  • Fix a typo in the generated documentation by @​wackbyte in bitflags/bitflags#271
  • Use SPDX license format by @​atouchet in bitflags/bitflags#272
  • serde tests fail in CI by @​arturoc in bitflags/bitflags#277
  • Fix beta test output by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#279
  • Add example to the README.md file by @​tiaanl in bitflags/bitflags#270
  • Iterator over all the enabled options by @​arturoc in bitflags/bitflags#278
  • from_bits_(truncate) fail with composite flags by @​arturoc in bitflags/bitflags#276
  • Add more platform coverage to CI by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#280
  • rework the way cfgs are handled by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#281
  • Split generated code into two types by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#282
  • expose bitflags iters using nameable types by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#286
  • Support creating flags from their names by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#287
  • Update README.md by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#288
  • Prepare for 2.0.0-rc.1 release by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#289
  • Add missing "if" to contains doc-comment in traits.rs by @​rusty-snake in bitflags/bitflags#291
  • Forbid unsafe_code by @​fintelia in bitflags/bitflags#294
  • serde: enable no-std support by @​nim65s in bitflags/bitflags#296
  • Add a parser for flags formatted as bar-separated-values by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#297
  • Prepare for 2.0.0-rc.2 release by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#299
  • Use strip_prefix instead of starts_with + slice by @​QuinnPainter in bitflags/bitflags#301
  • Fix up some clippy lints by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#302
  • Prepare for 2.0.0-rc.3 release by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#303
  • feat: Add minimum permissions to rust.yml workflow by @​gabibguti in bitflags/bitflags#305
  • fix a nit in the readme by @​s1rius in bitflags/bitflags#307
  • Prepare for 2.0.0 release by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#306

New Contributors

  • @​wackbyte made their first contribution in bitflags/bitflags#271
  • @​atouchet made their first contribution in bitflags/bitflags#272
  • @​tiaanl made their first contribution in bitflags/bitflags#270
  • @​rusty-snake made their first contribution in bitflags/bitflags#291
  • @​fintelia made their first contribution in bitflags/bitflags#294
  • @​nim65s made their first contribution in bitflags/bitflags#296
  • @​QuinnPainter made their first contribution in bitflags/bitflags#301
  • @​gabibguti made their first contribution in bitflags/bitflags#305
  • @​s1rius made their first contribution in bitflags/bitflags#307

Full Changelog: https://github.com/bitflags/bitflags/compare/1.3.2...2.0.0

Sourced from bitflags's changelog.

  • Add a parser for flags formatted as bar-separated-values by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#297
  • Prepare for 2.0.0-rc.2 release by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#299
  • Use strip_prefix instead of starts_with + slice by @​QuinnPainter in bitflags/bitflags#301
  • Fix up some clippy lints by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#302
  • Prepare for 2.0.0-rc.3 release by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#303

New Contributors

  • @​wackbyte made their first contribution in bitflags/bitflags#271
  • @​atouchet made their first contribution in bitflags/bitflags#272
  • @​tiaanl made their first contribution in bitflags/bitflags#270
  • @​rusty-snake made their first contribution in bitflags/bitflags#291

  • @​nim65s made their first contribution in bitflags/bitflags#296
  • @​QuinnPainter made their first contribution in bitflags/bitflags#301
  • @​gabibguti made their first contribution in bitflags/bitflags#305

Full Changelog: https://github.com/bitflags/bitflags/compare/1.3.2...2.0.0

2.0.0-rc.3

What's Changed

  • Use strip_prefix instead of starts_with + slice by @​QuinnPainter in bitflags/bitflags#301
  • Fix up some clippy lints by @​KodrAus in bitflags/bitflags#302

... (truncated)

Commits
  • b5a5ecf Merge pull request #306 from KodrAus/cargo/2.0.0
  • 777d640 include any bits not corresponding to a flag in into_iter
  • d1bd5e2 use rust-version for the MSRV
  • 646959d more CI tweaks
  • a1c15f6 fix up MSRV build
  • 8011843 Merge pull request #307 from s1rius/patch-1
  • dc8a577 fix yaml indentation
  • 7410f26 some adjustments to text parsing docs
  • c974b3b bump MSRV to 1.56.0
  • c0721eb fix a nit in the readme
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

candidates.title: Merge branch 'hotfix-sys-0.25.2' into 'master'
candidates.body: This gets the small changes from the hotfix-sys-0.25.2 (mainly the version bump of Cargo.toml) back into the default branch, to make history more clear.

candidates.title: Backport "bump sqlcipher to 4.5.2" to be included in a 0.25.2 of libsqlite3-sys
candidates.body:
In https://github.com/rusqlite/rusqlite/issues/1242 I failed to realize that our bundled version of SQLcipher still contains the vulnerability mentioned.

I'm cutting this as 0.25.2 by backporting it to avoid making a semver-incompatible change for now.

candidates.title: Change default minimal SQLite API version
candidates.body:
From 3.6.8 to 3.14.0.
Use `old_sqlite` feature to keep 3.6.8 (or 3.7.16) as the minimal version.
Use `modern_sqlite` for SQLite API > 3.14.0.
Also remove old 3.6.23 and 3.7.7 bindings.

chosen_pr.title: Backport "bump sqlcipher to 4.5.2" to be included in a 0.25.2 of libsqlite3-sys
chosen_pr.body:
In https://github.com/rusqlite/rusqlite/issues/1242 I failed to realize that our bundled version of SQLcipher still contains the vulnerability mentioned.

I'm cutting this as 0.25.2 by backporting it to avoid making a semver-incompatible change for now.

chosen_detail.title: Backport "bump sqlcipher to 4.5.2" to be included in a 0.25.2 of libsqlite3-sys
chosen_detail.body:
In https://github.com/rusqlite/rusqlite/issues/1242 I failed to realize that our bundled version of SQLcipher still contains the vulnerability mentioned.

I'm cutting this as 0.25.2 by backporting it to avoid making a semver-incompatible change for now.
